name: Ipswich Town FC History Quiz | Ipswich Town | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what year were the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1878.

	Although formed in 1878, the club did not turn professional until 1936.

questions.text: Where did Ipswich Town first play their home games?
questions.explanation:
Broom HIll.

	Ipswich played at Broom Hill between 1878-1883, then moved into Brook's Hall where they stayed until 1888 when they began playing at Portman Road.

questions.text: Who was the club's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
Mick O'Brien.

	O'Brien was manager between 1936-37, until he was succeeded by Duncan (1937-55), Ramsey was manager between 1955-63, and Milburn took up the hotseat for a season until 1964.

questions.text: Which of these made the most League appearances for Ipswich?
questions.explanation:
Mick Mills.

	Mick Mills made 591 League appearances between 1966-82.

questions.text: Which season saw Ipswich win the League's top-flight title for the first time?
questions.explanation:
1961-62.

	Ipswich took the title with 56 points from 42 games, 3 points ahead of second placed Burnley. This was their first ever League Championship.

questions.text: Two of Ipswich's 20th century managers had statues erected at Portman Road in their honour. Name the first one to have this honour bestowed upon them.
questions.explanation:
Alf Ramsey & Ramsey.

	Both Ramsey and Robson had this done for them, and both went on to manage England, Ramsey between 1963-74, and also won the World Cup in 1966. Robson was England manager between 1982-90, and took England to the World Cup semi-finals in 1990. Both men have also received a nighthood. Ramsey became Sir Alf in 1970, and Robson, Sir Bobby in 2003.

questions.text: Which team did Ipswich beat in 1964, to set the record for their biggest League victory?
questions.explanation:
Portsmouth.

	Ipswich beat Portsmouth 7-0 on 7th November, 1964.

questions.text: How many League goals did Ted Phillips score in the 1956-57 season?
questions.explanation:
41.

	This happened in the 1956-57 Division Three (South) season.

questions.text: In which season did Ipswich first enter the Football League?
questions.explanation:
1938-39.

	The club finished 7th out of 22 teams in the 1938-39 Division Three (South) season, with 44 points from 42 games.

questions.text: Who did Ipswich play in their first ever Premier League game?
questions.explanation:
Aston Villa.

	The game ended 1-1 at Portman Road, in the inaugural Premier League season in 1992-93, but Ipswich struggled throughout the season, finishing 16th out of 22 teams, just 3 points away from the relegation zone.
